title: cmd/gc: double declaration of variable with short-hand declaration is not illegal in if statement
body:
by **2852914@wessie.info**: 
What does 'go version' print?

go1.3.3 (playground)

What steps reproduce the problem?

http://play.golang.org/p/9QmhMAmrSG

What happened?

Compiles and runs

What should have happened instead?

Should be illegal to compile according to the spec on short-hand variable declarations
http://golang.org/ref/spec#Short_variable_declarations which states that "a, a :=
1, 2 // illegal: double declaration of a or no new variable if a was declared
elsewhere".
